text:
Hey, I have the same problem, we haven’t touched anything but the menu module seems to call another module, which breaks the main menu of the site.
Is there a solution?

Are you stilling this issue <@UL74QNG76>? In between when you posted and now the issue is marked as resolved (roughly 3 hours ago). If you aren’t seeing this resolved, please let me know so I can reopen the issue on our end

It is still not solved, you can notice it on this page: <https://www.simundia.com/cas-clients> where I left the module menu broken, on the other pages of the site I copied the content of the module in HTML to paste it raw until a better solution
is this not the correct menu?
I updated the page after posting my message and yes it’s the right menu, it’s solved, thank you
we had a a menu break yesterday as well
it just disappeared, the Support looked into it but i am not quite sure if they figured out the cause of the problem. I was told that it has something to do with Javascript but that is about it.
<@UBT0AHWLD> has it returned or is this still an issue?  If it is, can you send me the website this is appearing on?

it has returned a couple of hours ago. It is just not so comfortable for the client that the menu of a 80 + page website all of a sudden disappears before going live...and after that noone knows how to prevent this from happening again because noone  knows the cause...other than that it works flawlessly since returning

well I’m glad it’s back. Engineering is investigating the cause now actually. The latest update from them this morning was that they were able to recreate the issue locally with an old version of the deployable so they have narrowed it down to a specific build.  Haven’t quite nailed the cause down but they are getting closer
ah ok that is great to hear

hey man. It should be visible within the Design Manager

`Marketing > Files and Templates > Design Tools`
you can also right click on files to `View template source`
I find it’s easier to navigate when using the HubSpot developer chrome extension because it gives you a “Developer” menu item
also you might want to watch the videos in <https://academy.HubSpot.com/>
hello! does anyone have a tidy website example I could take a look at? I’m looking to get an idea of what a best practice site structure looks like
Specifically; how should assets be organised, when to use templates vs modules
